name: Hampton Inn & Suites Florence-North/I-95

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night when we traveled on I-95. The room was new, clean and attractive, and the free breakfast was excellent. My husband had to use the business center, and he said it was very well equipped. This hotel will be our new stop on I-95.
reviews.title: Great New Hotel on I-95

reviews.text: On our many journeys from Florida to the Northeast, we choose this one this time. Great exit off i-95. The hotel is brand new. Our room was clean, spacious and very nice decor. Spacious desk for free wi=fi. Bathroom was very pretty. Spacious counter with bath towels folded on bottom shelf. Granite counter...special touch. large tub & shower. Interior corridors displayed nice Thomasville furniture (by elavtor) lovely colors. Breakfast area, perfect! love the HAMPTON breakfast. I recommend this hotel for your stay through S.C. Indoor pool - clean. Friendlly staff...complimentary water bottle & cookies @ check in : ) I can always depend on excellent amentities with Hampton Inn & Suites.
reviews.title: Great Spot to Stop for the Night!

reviews.text: Stayed here while on my way down to Pawleys Island. This is a fairly new hotel, and one of the largest Hampton Inns that I've seen. The staff was friendly and check-in was a breeze, even as there were many people rolling through on their way to Myrtle Beach. Parking lot had full time security, and it was walking distance to restaurants. Big bobby, clean rooms, free WiFi, and flat screen TV. A perfect stop after a 9 hour drive!
reviews.title: A perfect stop when you're passing thru!

reviews.text: amazing hotel, rooms were far above what I expected. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Great snacks round the clock, wonderful breakfast. Rooms were terrific! Stay here
reviews.title: wow

reviews.text: Stayed here on our way to Jekyll Island in Georgia. Great location-walking distance to some restaurants and many within a one minute drive. Comfortable and clean..would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place for overnight
No faults
reviews.text: Our room at this 2 1/2-year-old Hampton with 136 units had absolutely no observable faults, which is rare in our experience. Even the sink stopper worked, and the refrigerator was quiet. We did not use any of the facilities like the workout room and pool. The usual Hampton breakfast. A little on the high side in terms of the rate, but seemingly comparable to other, newer Hamptons elsewhere at about $125 a night. Very convenient to I-95 on the north side of Florence.

You can get the same cleanliness and safety at lower priced hotel chains in the area. For the price, I expected cleaner breakfast tables and counters, better TV selection and a friendlier reception staff. Breakfast was a cut above their closest competitor but not worth the additional $35. The room was no different than less expensive competitors. The Cleanliness, Service and Room Conditions did not measure up to the higher cost. I cannot give a high rating for clean tables when they are no cleaner than less expensive hotels. When I have to wipe the crumbs and syrup off the table before I use it, I'm not happy unless I'm paying bargain rates. I tried to explain this to the staff in an Internet survey I was requested to take. After three email exchanges, he was still insulted that I expected more for the extra money. He was in denial and refused to believe that people expect more when they pay more. I've stay at the Hampton Inn near the Convention Center and that one is pristine for the money but not as convenient to I95.
reviews.title: Expected More for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well Krispy Kreme is next door, Cracker Barrell is 1/2 mile and right off 95, whats not to like? Pretty Standard Hampton Inn, what I expect from a HI property. Nice folks, clean everywhere I could see. Stayed 2x in month of May 11. Im a Hilton Hhonors and stay at HI often. Prefer their rates get lowered a bit. Weeknight I paid 111 with AARP 125 after tax, kinda high if you ask me.
reviews.title: Good Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hampton Inn Florence-North is one of the newer Hampton Inns. The hotel has very solid construction and fresh attractive decor. The breakfast area and lobby are spacious and well laid out. The staff is highly professional. Our king bedded room was very spacious and featured Hampton Inn's signature bed with crisp, fresh linens. The wireless internet, flat screen TV, and climate control features worked flawlessly. The large walk-in shower in the bathroom was great!
reviews.title: Excellent Hampton Inn

reviews.text: When traveling, Hampton Inns are our hotel of choice. We have stayed in them virtually all over the country. We stayed in this one Friday evening, late, 3/16/11, for first time. Will make it a favorite on our frequent trips on I-95
reviews.title: One of THE best Hamptons: new, best hot breakfast, friendliest reception on phone & in person

reviews.text: Wow. What a great hotel, conveniently located right off I 95 in Florence, SC. Needed a stop on our way back to Florida, and listened to other Trip Advisor ratings. Best continental breakfast, very clean, comfortable rooms, cozy linens, huge bathroom, nice pool area, free wifi. Perfect place to stop while traveling, but it would be comfortable to stay here longer as well...and you can't beat $115.00 total!
reviews.title: Perfect roadside stop...

reviews.text: As a Hilton Honors member I have stayed at my share of Hampton Inns, Hilton Gardens and Hilton Hotels. While the quality of the hotels are basically the same; upgraded in decor, clean, better than average complimentary breakfast, and predictable in a good way, it is the hotel staff at each that makes the difference.
reviews.title: Professional, yet Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The Florence Hampton Inn staff greeted me with southern charm upon arrival. Without a reservation, they had no way of knowing I was a Honors member but I was treated as one as soon as I approached the front desk.
reviews.title: Greatly Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I settled in to my clean, comfortable room and prepared for a long evening of work. The chair at my desk was extremely low which made computer work uncomfortable. My attempt to adjust the chair was unsuccessful so I requested assistance and maintenance responded within minutes. When he could not adjust the chair, he went to another room to make an exchange but we realized it wasn't an adjustment problem. The chairs are low--or perhaps I am short. Just as I was about to resign myself to a long uncomfortable night of work, there was a knock at the door. The front desk manager rolled in a high back, adustable chair from the conference room. A simple solution, yes. But as we all know, it's the little things that make the biggest difference.
reviews.title: A surprise at 2:00 am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend the Hampton Inn in Florence for its location, cleanliness, business center
reviews.title: Great place to stop

reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I stayed here one night on our way to Florida. It was comfortable, clean and quiet. The people working here were friendly. They also had a good breakfast. The hotel is convenient to the interstate and close to many good restaurants. We ate at the Cracker Barrel, which we all enjoyed. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean.

reviews.text: My family stopped at this hotel to take a break from a long trip. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Since I was with teenagers, the restaurant across the street from the hotel was perfect, forgot the name. My children enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub and had the pool to themselves for quite a while. A nice, pleasant place to stop off of I-95.
reviews.title: Convenient and Clean

reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this Hampton Inn & Suites! It is definately a step above the rest! From the extremely courteous and helpful front desk folks, to the spotless and well appointed common areas and room, to the more than comfortable bedding - it's all over the top terrific at a very reasonable rate! I heard no road noise, I heard no noise from other rooms - it was just absolute comfort from start to finish. Thanks for a great stay! I will be back when traveling through the area.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on our way from Florida to VA. It is a nice new hotel. The mattress was comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was large and clean. The breakast was the normal (but good) waffle, eggs, sausage, cereal, bagels, etc.. The only thing that bothered us was that the AC did not work and that our neighbors were pretty loud and kept slamming their door into the early hours of the morning. We contacted the front desk, but were told there were no other rooms availalbe to move to. In the morning, we mentioned the problem to the person at the front desk when asked, "how was your stay", and he offered no apologies or anything other than, "Oh." Not the response that we normally get at Hampton Inn since they have a 100% guarantee. We even contacted the website to complain, but never received any response. I have a feeling that this hotel makes a lot of $ since they are right on I-95 and half way between FL and many other states on the east coast.
reviews.title: Nice, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else if we were stopping over in Florence. It's only a little over 2 years old and the place is immaculate. Indoor pool with whirlpool which was what we needed after being on the road for 12 hours. The staff was very helpfull and courteous. Thank you Theresa for making a fresh pot of coffee for us at 2 o'clock in the morning.
reviews.title: This was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hampton Inn Florence is conveniently located right off I-95, across from a good chain restaurant (Fatz) and a Pilot gas station/truck stop. The facilities are well maintained, the free breakfast is great, and the check-in/checkout process is a breeze.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Florence

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way to Florida and were very pleased with the property and the staff. On arrival, I noticed there was a rail line paralleling the highway about fifty yards from the front of the hotel. My wife wondered if the passing trains would disturb our sleep; but I said the line was probably not in use because, I reasoned, would Hampton build a beautiful hotel that close to a rail line that would have trains running past? I guess Hampton isn't as smart as I thought, because during our night's stay, two freight trains, each with 50 to 80 cars, passed by merrily blowing whistles. One woke us at 11PM and the second roused us at 3AM.
reviews.title: Didn't need the trains at 3AM

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff were pleasant and helpful, and the free breakfast was worth all we paid for it. Fatz restaurant across the road had good food at reasonable prices, but if you go there on a Sunday, don't expect to order alcoholic beverages--for that, you'll have to cross the county line and dine in Florence City a few miles down I95.
reviews.title: Great last-minute stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveling home from FL, we were grateful to call and get the last room available. We ended up with a suite, which was very nice. Of course the cost was more than we had intended, but we were grateful to get a room on such a busy night. The room was clean, although it did have sort of a musty smell when we walked in. The room had a VERY comfortable king size bed, and our children were comfortable on the pull-out couch. We were pleased with all the amenities. Two small things that may not be an issue for anyone else, but the drapes (we were on the parking lot and street side of the building) did not have a liner behind them to gently block the light. If the drapes were opened even a crack, it was very bright. Also, the bathroom door would not stay cracked. With two young children, we like to have a small light coming from the bathroom. So it was either all the way open and very bright or closed and dark. In spite of those minor things, we had a very restful night's sleep. The breakfast was wonderful. Lots of choices and items were replenished quickly. Overall, it was a great experience.
reviews.title: Very helpful staff
Great stop on way thru i-95
reviews.text: My kudos go out to the staff at the Florence, South Carolina Hampton Inn & Suites just off I-95. My husband and I stayed there on our trip south to Florida. We noted that the fragrance that is sprayed after cleaning was very strong in our room. I have sensitivities to smells so we asked for help. We were shown two other rooms - treated very professionally and kindly - and were helped to more out things into the least fragrant of the rooms.

description: Our Hampton Inn & Suites Florence North I-95 is located minutes from Darlington Raceway and popular Florence, SC attractions. We offer many great amenities like free hot breakfast, free wi-fi, and free parking.
